definition: to leave without saying good-bye
(negative prefix)/not/no
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: It is exceedingly irresponsible of him to leave without saying goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 他这种不辞而别的行为是极其不负责的。

sentences.english: July, she will fly, and give no warning to her flight.
sentences.chinese: 七月，她远走高飞，对我不辞而别。

sentences.english: Why should you Frence leave so unexpected" surprise me how?"
sentences.chinese: 为何你要不辞而别这么意外的“惊喜叫我如何应对？

sentences.english: Did she take French leave at the party last Saturday?
sentences.chinese: 她在上星期六的聚会中不辞而别吗？

sentences.english: He left without saying good-bye , which made his friend angry.
sentences.chinese: 他的不辞而别使得他的朋友很生气。

sentences.english: Could you please give me a reason why you left without a word?
sentences.chinese: 请给我解释一下你不辞而别的理由好吗？

sentences.english: Then Ilsa tells Rick that why she had to leave him without any explanation.
sentences.chinese: 然后伊尔莎奉告力克为什么会不辞而别。

sentences.english: Suddenly, Rick peels out with the van.
sentences.chinese: 忽然，里克驾车不辞而别。

sentences.english: It is not manners that he took French leave yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天不辞而别是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: We agreed to fill volunteer together, did not expect her Frence leave.
sentences.chinese: 本来我们说好要一起填志愿的，没想到她不辞而别。

sentences.english: Serena: What I know is how you felt when I left without telling you.
sentences.chinese: 我现在体会到当初我不辞而别时你的感受。

sentences.english: Forgive me for leaving without telling you.
That's why you go away, I know, yes I know.
sentences.chinese: 那正是为何你不辞而别，是的，我知道。

sentences.english: She had no choice but left without saying goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 所以她没有别的选择，只好和力克不辞而别。

discouraged/downhearted
in a pique/sulky/cross
to leave home/to go off/to run away
to leave/to exit
to depart/to leave
to have no news whatever
to leave home (to live somewhere else)
to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
to take leave
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
gone forever
to cast away
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
on leaving/on the point of departure
